Name: The White House
Description: The official residence and workplace of the President of the United States.

Name: United States Capitol
Description: The home of the United States Congress and the seat of the legislative branch of the U.S. federal government.

Name: Lincoln Memorial
Description: A national monument built to honor the 16th President of the United States, Abraham Lincoln.

Name: Washington Monument
Description: An obelisk on the National Mall, built to commemorate George Washington.

Name: Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History
Description: A natural history museum administered by the Smithsonian Institution.

Name: Thomas Jefferson Memorial
Description: A presidential memorial dedicated to Thomas Jefferson, the third President of the United States.

Name: National Gallery of Art
Description: An art museum in Washington, D.C., located on the National Mall.

Name: Arlington National Cemetery
Description: A military cemetery across the Potomac River from Washington, D.C., in Arlington, Virginia.

Name: Library of Congress
Description: The research library that officially serves the United States Congress.

Name: FBI Headquarters
Description: The headquarters of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, located in the J. Edgar Hoover Building.
